metadata.Title: CVE-2020-6807 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Certified (focal) - medium.
metadata.Description: When a device was changed while a stream was about to be destroyed, the stream-reinit task may have been executed after the stream was destroyed, causing a use-after-free and a potentially exploitable crash. This vulnerability affects Thunderbird < 68.6, Firefox < 74, Firefox < ESR68.6, and Firefox ESR < 68.6. Update Instructions: Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-6807` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions: firefox - 74.0+build3-0ubuntu1 firefox-geckodriver - 74.0+build3-0ubuntu1 firefox-mozsymbols - 74.0+build3-0ubuntu1 No subscription required thunderbird - 1:68.6.0+build2-0ubuntu1 thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:68.6.0+build2-0ubuntu1 thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:68.6.0+build2-0ubuntu1 xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:68.6.0+build2-0ubuntu1 xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:68.6.0+build2-0ubuntu1 xul-ext-lightning - 1:68.6.0+build2-0ubuntu1 No subscription required

notes.Note: tyhicks> mozjs contains a copy of the SpiderMonkey JavaScript engine
